snippet.title: The Secret Garden nurtures a timeless tale
snippet.content: THE musical The Secret Garden, presented by the Caloundra Chorale and Theatre Co, is a timeless tale of a special place where faith, hope and love will conquer animosity, deceit and frailty. Mary Lennox, a 10-year-old orphan, travels from India to the moors of Yorkshire to be cared for by her uncle Archibald Craven. Archibald, a hunchback who is still grieving the loss of his beautiful wife, presides over a melancholy household. His son Colin, a cripple, is kept away from public view. Mary makes friends with many of the staff and Colin. She is confronted by Archie's brother, Dr Craven, who has his own agenda. But Mary and her friends discover the disused secret garden, bring it back to life and, in doing so, help to restore Colin and Archibald's life. A stellar cast including Grant Marks, Colin Butcher, Helen Duffy, Peter Voigt, Sarah Sullivan, Julie Marks and Helen Butcher bring this popular musical to life. The two children's roles are shared by Annie Hart and Madeline Robins playing Mary; and Louis Owen-Rogers and Jake Williams playing the crippled Colin. The Secret Garden performances are: August 11, 16, 18, 23, 25 and 30 plus September 1 at 7.30pm; and August 12, 13, 19 20, 26 and 27 plus September 2 and 3 at 2pm. Tickets cost: adults, $32, concessions $29, groups and FOC members $26 and children $17. Bookngs are essential. Call Ann on 5437 2719.
